intro: Rapanea chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapanese evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Central America, particularly in Mexico and parts of Guatemala. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a distinct aromatic scent, which is a common trait among members of its family. Rapanea chiapensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
